item.title: Aquabot Botnet Targeting Vulnerable Mitel Phones
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The Mirai-based Aquabot botnet has been targeting a vulnerability in Mitel SIP phones for which a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit exists.

The post Aquabot Botnet Targeting Vulnerable Mitel Phones appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 27, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 27, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Smiths Group Scrambling to Restore Systems Following Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Engineering firm Smiths Group has disclosed a cyberattack that forced it to take some systems offline and activate business continuity plans.

The post Smiths Group Scrambling to Restore Systems Following Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Rockwell Patches Critical, High-Severity Vulnerabilities in Several Products
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Rockwell Automation has released six new security advisories to inform customers about several critical and high-severity vulnerabilities.

The post Rockwell Patches Critical, High-Severity Vulnerabilities in Several Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2025: Artificial Intelligence
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Artificial intelligence is upending cybersecurity. It is used by adversaries in their attacks, and by defenders in their defense.

The post Cyber Insights 2025: Artificial Intelligence appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SimpleHelp Remote Access Software Exploited in Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Threat actors have been exploiting SimpleHelp remote access software shortly after the disclosure of three vulnerabilities.

The post SimpleHelp Remote Access Software Exploited in Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Frenos Raises $3.88M in Seed Funding for OT Security Assessment Platform
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Frenos, a company that has developed an autonomous OT security assessment platform, has raised $3.88 million in seed funding. 

The post Frenos Raises $3.88M in Seed Funding for OT Security Assessment Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: VMware Warns of High-Risk Blind SQL Injection Bug in Avi Load Balancer
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
VMware warns that a malicious user with network access may be able to use specially crafted SQL queries to gain database access.

The post VMware Warns of High-Risk Blind SQL Injection Bug in Avi Load Balancer appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Eclypsium Eyes Global Expansion with $45 Million Series C Investment
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
The investment includes equity and debt from new investors Qualcomm Ventures, Pavilion Capital, Singtel Innov8, and Sixty Degree Capital. 

The post Eclypsium Eyes Global Expansion with $45 Million Series C Investment appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Drain Over $85 Million From Crypto Exchange Phemex
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Hackers stole more than $85 million in crypto assets from hot wallets at cryptocurrency exchange Phemex.

The post Hackers Drain Over $85 Million From Crypto Exchange Phemex appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: NinjaOne to Acquire Dropsuite for $252 Million
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Endpoint management and security firm NinjaOne to acquire cloud data backup, archiving, and recovery solutions provider Dropsuite for $252 million.

The post NinjaOne to Acquire Dropsuite for $252 Million appeared first on SecurityWeek.
